721253f.text:
Madison Ave., west side, north from East 30th (left) to 31st Streets, showing prominently the Carroll House, No. 122 Madison Ave., that was built in 1907, as the Colony Club. For an article on same see the New York Times of February 17, 1907, Sunday Magazine Section, Part 3.
January 30, 1938.
George D. Chinn.

730238f-a.title: General view - [Manhattan - 30th Street - Madison Avenue (Northwest).]
730238f-a.text:
A general view, northwest from the N.E. corner of 30th Street and Madison Ave., showing the Empire State Building nearing completion.
August 2, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

721263f-a.text:
Madison Avenue, west side, south from 33rd Street, showing the Remsen and Backer buildingE, just completed, between 32nd and 31st Streets. Between 31st and 30th Streets may be seen the front of the old Colony Club building, which will be demolished
about 1918.
1916.
TRE NEw 7OEE
PUBLIC LIBRARY
TILDEN FOUNDwTRnE

721254f-a.text:
Madison Avenue, west side, from 30th to 33rd Streets, showing the newly completed Backer and Remsen Builcings, on the N.W. corner of 3lst and the S.i. corner of 32nd Streets, respectively.
Late 1916.
